column2: ILLINOIS DRIVERS PERMIT TEST

1. This road sign means:
column6: This lane is reserved for bicyclists

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead curves right, then left

column2: 3. According to Illinois law, drivers may NOT tow one vehicle with another except by a drawbar.
4. You may be charged with Aggravated DUI if you:
column4: Are involved in a personal injury crash while driving under the influence.
column6: Committed DUI with a valid driver’s license.
column8: Have received a second or subsequent DUI.

column2: 5. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to shift to lower gear.

column2: 6. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 7. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.

column2: 15. A driver must yield to a pedestrian when the pedestrian is entering an intersection with a flashing yellow arrow.

column4: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 18. Passing on a two-lane, two-way roadway is not allowed within 100 feet of an intersection or railroad crossing.
19. When driving on Illinois roadways, you automatically consent to submit to breath, blood and/or urine certain tests.
20. Regardless of fault, a crash report must be filed by the driver of a vehicle if the crash involves death or bodily injury.

column4: drive between vehicles in the funeral procession.
column6: yield the right of way to all vehicles in the procession.

column2: 22. BAC is expressed in:
column8: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

25. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.

column2: 26. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column8: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 30. This sign indicates that:
column4: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column6: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column8: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.

column2: 31. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column8: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column4: within 100 feet of an intersection or railroad crossing.

column2: 34. When two vehicles on different roadways reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time, the vehicle on the right should yield to the vehicle on the left.

column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
